lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can listen to a story and identify key characters, jobs, and job roles mentioned.
supportStrategies: (Listening) Pre-teach key job words before playing the story. Students tick jobs/roles they hear using a printed or SB checklist.
stretchStrategies: After reading, students rewrite the story ending with a “new job” for one character. They act it out and explain what the new job role is.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can read the story aloud, act it out, and answer questions using the target language.
supportStrategies: (Speaking) Assign story roles. Students rehearse with books, then perform without them. Ask follow-up questions about job roles in the story.
stretchStrategies: After reading, students rewrite the story ending with a “new job” for one character. They act it out and explain what the new job role is.

lessonOutcomes.outcome: Students can create a simple, imaginative ending to the story by drawing or performing it.
supportStrategies: (4Cs – Creativity) Pause story before ending. Ask: “What happens next in their job?” Students draw the final page and share it with a partner.
stretchStrategies: After reading, students rewrite the story ending with a “new job” for one character. They act it out and explain what the new job role is.

items: Consonant clusters do not exist in Vietnamese words, so they need special attention. Remember that clusters don't come only at the beginning of words – end clusters can be even harder (dogs, task, crisp, crisps, snacks)
Hai con chó >> two dog [two dogs]. Not only the form, but the pronunciation is tough here, as it changes depending on the final sound of the noun [s,z,iz]

Unstressed vowels do not really exist in Vietnamese, so these need extra practice. Make sure the final vowel of computer is a light schwa, not a heavy com-pu-TER. Same with the final vowel of banana. Or the second syllable of elephant. And so on.

In Vietnamese, final consonants are 'held in' – you don't actually hear them released. But in English, the final consonant of cat, top, rock, and so on are released with a puff of air. Make sure you are aware of this difference.
